creator: sunny6904@hotmail.com
text:
Is it possible to have a more fine grained control over the timers where they 
can be set after HTTP url in once only logic..
example scenario
1 thread group
  1.1 simple controller
    1.1.1 once only logic
      1.1.1.1 http request
      1.1.1.2 timer
    1.1.2 interleave logic
       1.1.2.1 simple controller
          1.1.2.1.1 http GET request
          1.1.2.1.2 timer 
       1.1.2.2 simple controller
          1.1.2.2.1 HTTP POST 
          1.1.2.2.2 timer

If so what classes do I need to modify to achieve this scenario ?
Any help would be appreciated.

What if you/we were to create a new type of generative controller that did 
nothing delayed?  If this existed, you could put it wherever within a test 
script, and it would cause a delay at that point.  This would be extremely easy 
to do, and might replace the timers altogether.  Or be an addition to them.

Alternatively, or additionally, I could create a new config element that 
specified a delay, and such a config element could be attached to any 
controller in the test, and jmeter's sampling engine could read this config 
element and carry out the delay prior (or following) that sample.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
mstover1@apache.org
text: *** Bug 6729 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Yes, now timers can be added anywhere in the test tree.  All timers that apply
for a Sample will be added together.
